medical_history.chief_complaint: Fetal goiter and hypothyroidism diagnosed coincidentally during pregnancy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Fetal goiter was diagnosed by ultrasound at the sixth month of gestation. High serum TSH (336 mU/liter) confirmed hypothyroidism. A second ultrasound at 27 weeks showed further goiter enlargement (34/21 mm). Two intraamniotic injections of levothyroxine were performed during the seventh month, with ultrasound revealing a goiter size of 30/18 mm during the eighth month. The woman delivered a female infant at term with an Apgar score of 10 at 1 and 5 minutes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The parents had no history of past thyroid diseases; no other relevant medical history mentioned.
medical_history.family_history: The parents were nonconsanguineous, and there was no historical evidence of iodine deficiency or thyroid diseases in the family.
